title: Hey, could anyone plz suggest any good champs for learning new roles?:3
body:
Hey guys! Soooo I'm a reasonably new player, lvl20 but I honestly don't feel like I've improved much since lvl10. I think this is because I don't really necessarily enjoy playing NEW champions, which is why right now I can only mid and sup(been sticking with Ahri, Lux and Soraka for aaagggeess now) :(. 

I'd love to learn some new roles and I have a reasonable amount of IP, so could anyone plz suggest any good champs to start learning a role? Tyty:) 

PS. I've been thinking about learning Nami as a new champ for support(her 
kit looks rlly versatile), would she be a good choice?:P

Edit: WOOHOO, I now have a full list of amazing champs to try out!!!:D You guys 
are amazing, thanks so much!:)

replies.body: Twisted Fate and Ryze man, Ryze for learning ability combos, TF for map awareness. Or if you just want to win, play someone hella easy and strong like Yasuo or Ahri

> [{quoted}](name=Gravelord,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2016-01-03T02:23:27.524+0000)
>
> Twisted Fate and Ryze man, Ryze for learning ability combos, TF for map awareness. Or if you just want to win, play someone hella easy and strong like Yasuo or Ahri

Tyty for the info!!!:3 OF COURSE I WANT TO WIN, but ummmm I don't think it's simple as 1.Choose Yasuo/Ahri and 2.Faceroll to victory :P Tf's pick a card seems good to practice reflexes, I'll be sure to try him out!:)

Well you've got pretty good Mids and Supports. Ahri is my fave to mid probably followed by Lux. Morgana's my main Sup, she's pretty similar you'd probably like her too.

Easiest champs to learn the other roles IMO:
JG - Warwick
Top - Garen
ADC - Ashe, Tristana

They're all fairly basic, safe and solid choices. Ashe is definitely the 'beginner' ADC but I much preferred learning on Tristana since she's a lot more forgiving if you find yourself in the wrong spot. (Longest range, W jump for escape, R to knock anyone who gets to you away). Garen's tanky and fast, with an insanely simple kit and Warwick pulls off great ganks just by hitting R.

Good luck!! :)

> [{quoted}](name=TK9277,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-01-03T03:27:16.547+0000)

Awww thanks so much for the informative post!!:3 Most of the suggestions look really similar so I'm definitely gonna try warwick, morgana, trist and etc. as soon as I get the chance!:) Thanks so much again and gl to u too!:D

Since you like playing mid and support, I'd suggest Morgana :)
She was the first champion I really enjoyed and everyone I've suggested Morg have loved her. 

If you like the mobility of Ahri, I also suggest Ekko. He is a flex pick (mid, top or jg) so once you get good at him, you can try him in other roles. Plus he's a lot of fun!

> [{quoted}](name=littlemisscheeky,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-01-03T01:32:25.931+0000)
>
> Since you like playing mid and support, I'd suggest Morgana :)
> She was the first champion I really enjoyed and everyone I've suggested Morg have loved her. 
> 
> If you like the mobility of Ahri, I also suggest Ekko. He is a flex pick (mid, top or jg) so once you get good at him, you can try him in other roles. Plus he's a lot of fun!

I definitely enjoy the mobility of Ahri, being able to reposition myself 3 times has helped soo much with gameplay and etc.!:D Flex pick sounds rlly cool, one of the main reasons I enjoyed lux was because I was able to play her in 2 positions so if I didn't get mid then I could play her sup(which no one seems to like for some reason...cmon guys support is fun xD)!

Morgana's kit seems really similar to Lux's and her cc defying shield will be awesome against Blitzcrank...(a champ I hate playjng against):P. That and being able to be played mid and support makes me feel like she'll quickly become one of my fav champs!:D Bought Morg a few weeks ago(only done customs with her so far) so I'll be sure to try her out ASAP!:)

Thanks so much!!!:)

Definitely give Morgana a go if you don't like champions like Blitz and Thresh. Black shield will render their grabs/hooks useless, plus it will be good practice in terms of anticipating your opponents' moves.

> [{quoted}](name=littlemisscheeky,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2016-01-03T23:19:51.540+0000)
>
> Definitely give Morgana a go if you don't like champions like Blitz and Thresh. Black shield will render their grabs/hooks useless, plus it will be good practice in terms of anticipating your opponents' moves.

I'll be sure to do just that, thx again!!!:)

Top - Shen. This would force you to pay attention to your map and your ally health bars, which is a necessity, and gives you experience at initiating fights and tanking
Support Soraka - ^ pretty much the same reason, but also gives you good practice at timing skillshots and managing your own HP
Ashe ADC -  decent last hit training as well as practice at positioning since she does not have much in the way of escape besides slows
Jungle - probably warwick, easy to pick up and gets through clears relatively easy so you can focus on gank paths

> [{quoted}](name=LuckyCharm,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-03T00:59:29.837+0000)
>
> Top - Shen. This would force you to pay attention to your map and your ally health bars, which is a necessity, and gives you experience at initiating fights and tanking
> Support Soraka - ^ pretty much the same reason, but also gives you good practice at timing skillshots and managing your own HP
> Ashe ADC -  decent last hit training as well as practice at positioning since she does not have much in the way of escape besides slows
> Jungle - probably warwick, easy to pick up and gets through clears relatively easy so you can focus on gank paths

Ah yes it's super fun when playing soraka to run around and spam heal your allies, then just hit the enemy with a q and regain your health haha. She has taught me quite a lot about map awareness and keeping watch on my teammates health bars:D

I got shen in a mystery champ chest, was planning to try him soon and you just gave me awesome encouragement! xD Thanks so much!!!:))
teemo is good XD

> [{quoted}](name=lordofrage,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-01-02T22:53:01.913+0000)
>
> teemo is good XD

*raises eyebrows* Well I do own teemo...shall I start playing him in normals and get him to lvl5 mastery?:P

For Mid I would recommend Zed since positioning his shadows is really important and if you misposition his shadows you get punished for it.
For Jungle I would recommend Lee Sin Or Udyr. Lee Sin for learning that landing your skillshot is really important and udyr so you choose your skills wisely on given situations.
For Adc I would recommend Vayne since Vayne relies on positioning for her Condem (E) and you will really learn how crucial positioning is in fights.
For Top I would recommend Gnar. Gnar is basically kiting your enemy till you reach Mega Gnar. I say learn Gnar for top since you would have to adapt to 2 different playstyles and again positioning for Mega Gnar's ult. Adapting to 2 different playstyles is in my opinion really good.

These champions are in my opinion not that easy to play but if you are looking to improve, I say start from these champions.

P.s
I might be a little bias for Mid since I am a Zed main but if you are looking to improve map awareness then go with twisted fate.


Edit 1:
I forgot about shen!!!!
Shen is good for top and developing awareness since you really have to look at the fights that are going on at other lanes and also at the same time watch yourself from getting cced to cancel your ult.

I started off playing Ryze (before he was reworked) and played him for probably a hundred games. The problem is you get bored, and don't really progress. You need to play different roles to learn how to play the actual game better, then in turn use that knowledge to better your knowledge of individual champions.

First piece of advice, play ARAM. It's a fun game mode, but best of all, it makes you try new, random champs. I remember playing a few champs there I never thought I'd play and going "Wow! This guy is so cool/fun!". That was Cho' Gath, that was Fizz, that was Ammumu. I now have 50K mastery in Cho, regulary carry with him, and play Fizz and Ammumu a lot and carry with them too. It's a fun, quick, and easy way to try out new champion mechanics.

Second piece of advice, go through the list of champions. Pick out a full list of every champion you think looks cool, that you've played with and wanted to try, or just for some reason are drawn to. For my I had a list of about 12 champions I reallllly wanted to play. Go through the list. Try them out if they're free to play. Research them online, and see what their builds are. What role they play. At the end of a month, I'd picked up a few and now main them, crossed out a couple because I really didn't like their mechanics (Tryndamere was one of them - I thought he was OP, but I could just never figure out how to play him), and added a few more. It's important to go through and see what appeals to you, and no one else, because it's fine winning with a champ, but if you don't enjoy it, there's not much point.

Next, you need to specialise from that list at least one or two champions from that list for each role. So two top, two mid, two jungle, two supports (admittedly, I only really play one ADC because I don't really like the role and the pressure it brings to carry). And for each of those, make sure the role has two different champions types. For example, a tanky jungler, and an assassin jungler. As you learn to play more, you'll learn that all teams need a certain type of champion on them to be consistently successful. CC champs, tanks, initiators, damage dealers, AP/AD, utility etc. Having loads of options for each game means you can learn the different roles, and the roles within those roles.

Personally, I like champs that you can adapt. Champions like Singed or Urgot can really only be built one, at a stretch two, ways. I think champions that can be built in many different ways are far superior, and teach you how to play far more, as item builds are half the game. For example, AD Shaco, or maybe AP Shaco. Sion built full tank, or maybe an AD/Lifesteal Sion? Those sorts of champions are what I'd recommend aiming to get.

You can take one champion, and use it in so many roles and learn so much. For example Shaco. High skill cap, but can be easily played. I've seen him top, mid, jungle, even support as AP. You can build him tanky, crit, ap, ad, assassin, utility… with a versatile champ like him, you can learn roles, lanes, build types, the own champion mechanics, and much more. This can branch off; you might enjoy playing tankier champs, or the support role, or enjoy a certain style of play, and find more champs like that. That's what I'd recommend getting.

So it's up to you what appeals, but in terms of champions that fill that sort of versatile role, here would be my picks (from those I've played): Bard, Chogath, Ekko, Ezreal, Fizz, Gangplank, Kayle, Lee Sin, Lulu, Lux, Malphite, Morgana, Nasus, Shaco, Sion, Sona, Thresh, Warwick, Zac.

I played ARAM exclusively from lvl12-15, so I'm able to play quite a few champs decently(Leblanc, evelynn, kogmaw, heimer and etc.). I didn't go on and buy any of the champs I played in ARAM tho mainly because non of them seemed a quarter as fun as Ahri/Lux...In fact I think I'd still be playing aram exclusively to this day if it weren't for the bots and the queue time. Queuing for over 10 mins(VERY common) just to end up in a game of bots(their igns have such an obvious pattern, such as ending in z) :( Sure, free wins are nice, but it just takes away the fun...I love a good challenge:D

You make Shaco sound really awesome. I love versatile champs too since I like experimenting with different builds and playstyles!:D Also I'm definitely planning on learning all roles(preferably 3 champs per role?) before ranked so I can proudly fill instead of being one of those ppl who can only play 1/2 roles(which is what I am right now). Also, my friend recommended Amumu for jungle, so I'm probably gonna learn him after Warwick:D

Thx so much for the advice!!!:)

No problem.

So what draws you to Ahri and Lux? Maybe that can help me pin point areas of other champions you might like?

> [{quoted}](name=The Spawn Man,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TBEUzpIX,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2016-01-05T07:33:14.621+0000)
>
> No problem.
> 
> So what draws you to Ahri and Lux? Maybe that can help me pin point areas of other champions you might like?

Ah, good question! Well, I was just surfing through the store(mostly reading the champs section), and I took one look at Ahri's kit and just thought, hey she seems like an awesome champ! It was mostly her ult, being able to dash around 3 times sounded really awesome coz at that level I was getting caught out of position all the time. My friends also recommended her and I got so excited that I refund sona(sorry sona!!!:( ) just to buy her asap:P She was my first mid champ and I certaining don't regret purchasing her. So basically I love ahri's mobility and the way she can catch 1 person with charm and they're pretty much dead:D

As for Lux...that was back to at level8 in coop vs ai when I played soraka bot so I had to go against the Ashe and Lux lane tonnes of times and I died A LOT, 1 successful light binding and I'm dead:( Then I came across a few rage posts on the old forums about Lux's range(which sounded awesome as a beginner since I can attack without being in danger) and her burst(I think I mostly like champs that have a way to kill the opponent b4 they can react, such as ahri's charm which renders then useless). Since she was so annoying as a bot, I wondered what she would be like mastered by a player, so I decided to buy her and try her out. It was confusing at first(all skillshots) but now I owe Lux a great deal in getting much much better and landng skillshots and avoiding them:D Plus she's slowly teaching me to play with an unlocked camera...can't do it yet but I can see how it would help so I'm gonna try xD 

I'm pretty sure that I'd love Morgana too since cc=dead me and her shield would prevent that, which means hopefully a lot less dying!:) Also the other parts of her kit are pretty similar to Lux's so she'll definitely be fun:D

So it looks like you like champs which allow you mobility/escapes, some cc and potential to shut down opponents as you 1v1 them?

I would definitely recommend the following:

Bard - Excellent mobility and his E is great for escapes and luring to traps. Loads of CC (IMO the best cc kit in the game, and on paper, his R's stasis is the best CC in the game). High skill cap, and if you play him right, can shut down opponents as you pepper them with meeps. Can be built support, jungler or mid, and AD, AP or full utility.

Ekko - Haven't played him myself, but seems to have everything you're looking for.

Fizz - Again, great mobility. His E allows you to exit duels without fear and escape through the jungle. Not much in terms of CC, but otherwise a great champ to learn.

Lee Sin - So mobile, so much duelling potential. Very high skill cap. Tank or ad.

Shaco - The master of jump scares. Shaco is so fun to play. Your Q lets you disengage/engage and effectively insta-gib your opponents if you build a dmg build. You can even escape over walls with it. Along with his R - a clone that effectively forces your opponents to choose which Shaco to chase - allows for even more safe duelling and escapes. Has a tiny bit of CC with his W, and his E has a pretty high range and power. Can be built AD, AP, tank… and can do all roles.

Zac - Tanky, loads of range, and plenty of CC, Zac is great as AP mid, jungle, support, tank, top… everywhere! His E lets you engage or escape from afar. You can farm safely with your high health and passive (effectively a free Guardian Angel). Plus who doesn't like a cool, squishy blob for a champion?

Lmao love your description for Zac xD. Thanks so much! I'm looking forward to the new free week rotations, so many champs to try out!!!:D

Top: Garen
Jungle: Warwick
Mid: Lux and Ahri are good, Annie is another easy one.
ADC: Trist and Ashe?
Support: Nami is good but hard, maybe Leona?

Thx so much!!! I tried annie in aram once...but I can't control tibbers properly for my life(that was playing with a trackpad tho, maybe better now that I have a mouse haha) xD
Thanks again for these suggestions, I'll definitely try them out!:))

You are very welcome :) BTW I'm a semi Ahri main (well I was in Season 5, not so much this season) and stick with her! Learn her and master her! She is probably the most versatile mid lane pick there is and is good in just about every situation :)

Nami is a great support!
